page.title: 09Farming, Faceby (page i)
page.content: There are 14 farms in and around Faceby, ranging from 50 to 300 acres; most of them were part of the Faceby and Carlton Estate which was sold in 1942.{The soil,}chiefly boulder clay, is fairly fertile in the lowland area, the principal{crops}being wheat, barley, potatoes, oil-seed rape and a few winter oats. Most farms make {silage}and although fields are relatively small and do not require large{machines,}most farmers have their own combine harvester. There are 4 dairy farms,{cattle}being chiefly Friesian and Friesian-X. Milk is collected by tanker.{Sheep}for breeding are mainly Mashams (Swaledale x Teeswater) and Mules (Swaledale x Blue-faced Leicester). Faceby Lodge has a{pig unit}of 150 sows and 7 boars. Stock is sold at{markets}in Stokesley and Northalleron.
